posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked:
Hello, I am using a trajectory generator to generate a path and a SwerveControllerCommand to control the modules like the following:

For some reason, when I run this auton path, the robot’s wheels seem to jitter around in random directions almost, and behave randomly. Sometimes when I run the code, the robot goes forwards, while other times it goes backwards and sometimes it doesn’t even move.

posts.name: Collin
posts.cooked: I would start by making an InstantCommand to zero the drive encoders, that way it will likely fix the backward driving issue. Other than that, have you run the sysid tool on your robot?

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: No, would that be the root of the problem?

posts.name: Collin
posts.cooked: That could be. The values given in the tutorial are very robot specific so that could cause the jittering.

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: It turns out the jittering was just because of a high p value. The issue is probably because I didn’t characterize the drivetrain .

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: One more question: how do I make the robot go backwards using a trajectory generator. When I try to set the final poses x value to a negative number, it gives me could not parameterize spline error

posts.name: Collin
posts.cooked: There should be a setting when generating the trajectory to make it revered. setReversed(boolean reversed) should do the trick.

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Wait, I don’t see that method. if example Trajectory was my trajectory, would this be what your talking about:

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Oh wait, nevermind I found it

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
